Among the requirements for the role are 10+ years of relevant experience and a degree in architecture, engineering, construction management, or a related field. html:
• anchor

    Following our previous look at an opening for a Rendering and Visualization Designer at Doug Aitken Workshop, we are using this week’s edition of our Job Highlights series to explore an open role on Archinect Jobs for a Sector Director - Educational Design at Pickering Associates.

    The role, based in Parkersburg, WV, calls for a “client-focused professional who understands the unique requirements of educational facilities” from K-12 through to higher education. Among the requirements for the role are 10+ years of relevant experience and a degree in architecture, engineering, construction management, or a related field.

    Why the role interests us

    The open role for a director in educational design at Pickering Associates comes at a time of high activity in the sector. In recent weeks, our editorial reported on the completion of a renovation of Rice School of Architecture’s MD Anderson Hall by Kwong Von Glinow while in May, the tallest mass timber academic building on the East Coast was completed for UPenn.

    In another record-breaking move, Canada’s tallest academic timber building broke ground at the University of Toronto in April, at the same time that Olson Kundig prepared to break ground on a new student center at Rice University. Other notable academic buildings recently completed include Studio Gang’s STEM building at Spelman College and Provencher_Roy’s business school for HEC Montréal.
